episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a unique Alaskan city where most residents live in a single building, the ancient origins of birthday parties involving animal sacrifices, the human invention of saffron and its labor-intensive cultivation, and the methods actors use to produce tears on demand.

facts.fact: There's a city in Alaska where almost the entire population lives in one building.
The earliest known kids birthday party included the sacrifice of a sheep.
In order to achieve tears in a scene, actors are often shot in the face with a crying stick.
